subject: Politics
title: Media Literacy
description: A short lesson to help you apply Media Literacy.

hook.text: Finland teaches media literacy in elementary school. Its citizens are among the most resistant to disinformation.

buildup.text: Media literacy means the ability to critically evaluate sources, detect bias, and distinguish news from opinion.

discovery.text: Studies show media-literate people are better at spotting fake news and less susceptible to manipulation.

twist.text: Most education systems don't teach media literacy. Students graduate unable to evaluate the information flooding them.

climax.text: In the age of AI and deepfakes, media literacy isn't a nice-to-have. It's a survival skill for democracy.

punchline.text: Media literacy is democratic self-defense. Without it, citizens are unarmed.

quiz.question: Which country is a leader in teaching media literacy?
options: Finland, which teaches it from elementary school
No country currently teaches media literacy
The United States, which requires it in all schools
